questions.question: Consider the following statements relative to air density and select the one which is correct:
options: a. Because air density increases with decrease of temperature, air density must increase with increase of height in the International Standard Atmosphere (ISA)
b. At any given surface temperature the air density will be greater in anticyclonic conditions than it will be when the MSL pressure is lower
c. Air density increases with increase of relative humidity
d. The effect of change of temperature on the air density is much greater than the effect of change of atmospheric pressure

questions.question: The tropopause in mid latitudes is:
options: a. lower in summer with a lower temperature
b. lower in winter with a higher temperature
c. lower in summer with a higher temperature
d. lower in winter with a lower temperature

questions.question: Generally as altitude increases:
options: a. temperature decreases and density increases
b. temperature, pressure and density decreases
c. temperature and pressure increase and density decreases
d. temperature decreases and pressure density increases

questions.question: In the troposphere:
options: a. over cold air, the pressure is higher at upper levels than at similar levels over warm air
b. over cold air, the pressure is lower at upper levels than at similar levels over warm air
c. over warm air, the pressure is lower at upper levels than at similar levels over warm air
d. the upper level pressure depends solely on the relative humidity below

questions.question: Density at the surface will be low when:
options: a. pressure is high and temperature is high
b. pressure is high and temperature is low
c. pressure is low and temperature is low
d. pressure is low and temperature is high

questions.question: Which of the following combinations will give the lowest air density?
options: a. Low pressure, low humidity, low temperature
b. High pressure, high temperature, high humidity
c. High pressure, low temperature, low humidity
d. Low pressure, high humidity, high temperature
